User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.10 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/8.0.552.237 Safari/534.10
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0E)

In case iframe is hidden (style="display: none;") and we change hash of it's contentWindow (window.location.hash = "#new" if JS is evaluated inside of iframe) then content of entire iframe is reloaded. If we make iframe visible and change it's hash again then reloading does not occurs.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create hidden iframe pointing to some src. Sample: <iframe src="some path" style="display: none;" id="the-iframe"></iframe>
2. Set hash of the iframe to some value. Sample: document.getElementById("the-iframe").contentWindow.location.hash = "#blank";
Actual Results:  
iframe source gets reloaded

Expected Results:  
iframe source should not be reloadedt if hash only part of the locaion is changed.
After making iframe visible hash changes cases no reloading which is correct.

I have reproduced this issue on latest firefox build at Windows 7 and Mac OSX.

Created attachment 505050
ZIP with index.html and iframe.html that reproduces the issue.

In the attachment there is zip with two html files in it. Just extract the files and open index.html. When you open it you should see alert comming from iframe content (iframe.html). When you click Change iframe hash you will see the alert again (content get's reloaded). If you make iframe visible (click Toggle iframe) and then click 'Change iframe hash' content reloading does not occurs.
